title: Which team will win the 2019 Rugby World Cup?
preds: Going Up on SA cuz if the Nationals can win the World Series...

As a South African I have a strong Bias towards a bok win :)
However, the Brits are very strong!
So, patriotism wins, I favour my team with strong conviction and high hopes.
England looked very strong against New Zealand, but of course SA has a better record at the world cup...

If I was placing a bet, the smart money would be for England to win, everything points to England taking the World Cup, but South Africa can rise to the occasion and beat the odds. Either way should make for a great game
Adjusted after the semi-finals.  England look very strong going into the final.

England's team looked unbeatable against New Zealand. New Zealand gave South Africa a loss in pool play.  There were too many handling errors by SA against Wales and though a big, tough team with depth England's coaching and play making ability will be the deciding factor.
Adjusted forecast after the semi-finals. Used current odds from oddschecker.com England 1/2 and SA 15/8. These look like reasonable odds so I haven't adjusted them.
How does a Welshman make it to the world cup? As a referee (free - and multi purpose - any nationality will do).
England and South Africa are facing in the finals, where England is the favorite.

Eng 19 - NZ 7
NZ 23 - RSA 13 Eng 40 - Aussies 16
Wales 29 - Aussies 25

As a baseline, I took the odds from Oddschecker as quoted in [1] (I'm in the public library so I can't access the odds directly): New Zealand: 5/6  
South Africa: 10/3  
England: 9/2  
Wales: 11/1  I then converted these odds into implied probability following the process set out in [2]. Correcting for over-rounding I calculate the implied probabilties as: New Zealand: 52%
South Africa: 22%
England: 17%
Wales: 8% Personally, I think this slightly underestimates the chance that England will beat New Zealand and the chance that Wales will beat South Africa in the semi-final round so I've tweaked the probabilities to reflect my thinking. [1] https://www.theweek.co.uk/2019-rugby-world-cup/103204/rugby-world-cup-japan-winner-predictions-webb-ellis-cup
[2] https://www.investopedia.com/articles/dictionary/042215/understand-math-behind-betting-odds-gambling.asp

usually the answer is New Zealand but their team is one of the weakest they had.
englad seems to have a good chance thanks to their legacy

All Blacks have the history, WC record and have grown into the tournament. They will beat England most likely and face SA in final. SA second biggest chance as more likely than England to get to final. England have bigger chance of beating NZ than Wales do of beating SA.

New Zealand and England . New Zealand 23, RSA 13.  In addition, in pool B, NZ has slightly better results than RSA against Italy, Namibia and Canada.  70% odds on NZ If they meet RSA in the finals.   50-50 NZ vs England. Wales vs RSA.  In pool C, England finished 1st, France 2nd. Although England and France did not face each other (weather?), England had consistently better results against their common foes: Argentina, Tonga and the USA.  Wales had several close matches (+4 Australia, +12 Fiji, +1 France) giving Wales 30% odds vs RSA due to Wales low margins in previous matches.  Based on the  Wales defeat of France (20-19), giving 70% odds to England If they meet in the finals. Starting with low odds on Wales if they make the finals against either NZ or England.  And even odds for any other side that makes the finals. World Rankings:
NZ: 1st
England: 2nd
Wales: 3rd
RSA: 4th
